chapterMeaning: The Yoga of Royal Knowledge and Royal Secret
sanskrit:
यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् ।
यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् ॥
transliteration:
yat karoṣi yad aśnāsi yaj juhoṣi dadāsi yat |
yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣva mad-arpaṇam ||
translation: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer in sacrifice, whatever you give away, whatever austerity you practice, O son of Kunti, do that as an offering to Me.
commentary:
This verse is one of the most practical and universally applicable teachings in the Bhagavad Gita. Krishna instructs Arjuna to transform every action, no matter how mundane or sacred, into an offering to the Divine. The verse encompasses the entire spectrum of human activity: work (karoṣi), eating (aśnāsi), ritual worship (juhoṣi), charity (dadāsi), and spiritual practices (tapasyasi). By sanctifying all actions through dedication to God, the practitioner transcends the binding nature of karma and transforms ordinary life into spiritual practice.

This teaching represents the essence of Karma Yoga presented in Chapter 9. It provides a simple yet profound method for constant remembrance of God and integration of spiritual life with worldly duties. The verse does not ask one to renounce activities but to change one's attitude and intention behind them. When actions are performed as offerings to the Divine rather than for personal gain, they become purifying and liberating rather than binding. This approach makes spirituality accessible to all, regardless of their station in life or occupation.

The philosophical significance lies in the transformation of consciousness from ego-centered to God-centered living. This verse bridges bhakti (devotion) and karma yoga (path of action), showing how devotional surrender can be practiced through every activity. It establishes that spiritual life is not separate from daily life but is the sanctification of it. This teaching has inspired countless practitioners to see their entire life as worship and has become a foundational principle for integrating spirituality into modern living.
speaker: Krishna
